Title: Conrad Lauritz Holm Death Obituary 1943
Text:
Original in English


<-SPLITTLETTER->


Death Announcement
Merchan Conrad L. Holm, Hegra, has died, at the age of 62.
He was born in Hegra and came into business life at an early age. He started at
Lundgren’s store at Hell in 1900 (village close to Hegra) and later he was in the large
firm A-S Lindgård in Hegra and then for many years with B. Schwer and Hegra
Samvirkelag (a co-op grocery store). For several years he ran his own store in Sona and
in Hegra. He was a well qualified counter assistant and gained many friends. He was
also a writer and has published a collection of poems and a book of stories. He was also
a keen mission friend and temperance man and for a while he was a member of
Inntrøndelag (Inner Trøndelag) Regional Council of D.N.T. (no idea what this stands
for), and the chairman of Hegra temperance association for more than 20 years.
Description:
Description only in English

<-SPLITDESC-> 

NEWSPAPER CLIPPING ANNOUNCING THE DEATH OF CONRAD LAURITZ
HOLM (HE DIED JANUARY 6-1943).
